verses.verse: Behold,<WH4428> a king shall reign<WH4427> in righteousness,<WH6664> and princes<WH8269> shall rule<WH8323> in justice.<WH4941>

A man<WH376> shall be as a hiding place<WH4224> from the wind,<WH7307> and a covert<WH5643> from the storm,<WH2230> as streams<WH6388> of water<WH4325> in a dry place,<WH6724> as the shade<WH6738> of a large<WH3515> rock<WH5553> in a weary<WH5889> land.<WH776>
The eyes<WH5869> of those who see<WH7200> will not be dim,<WH8159> and the ears<WH241> of those who hear<WH8085> will listen.<WH7181>
The heart<WH3824> of the rash<WH4116> will understand<WH995> knowledge,<WH1847> and the tongue<WH3956> of the stammerers<WH5926> will be ready<WH4116> to speak<WH1696> plainly.<WH6703>
The fool<WH5036> will no longer be called<WH7121> noble,<WH5081> nor the scoundrel<WH3596> be<WH559> highly respected.<WH7771>

For the fool<WH5036> will speak<WH1696> folly,<WH5039> and his heart<WH3820> will work<WH6213> iniquity,<WH205> to practice<WH6213> profanity,<WH2612> and to utter<WH1696> error<WH8442> against Yahweh,<WH3068> To make empty<WH7324> the soul<WH5315> of the hungry,<WH7457> and to cause the drink<WH4945> of the thirsty<WH6771> to fail.<WH2637>

The ways<WH3627> of the scoundrel<WH3596> are evil.<WH7451> He devises<WH3289> wicked devices<WH2154> to destroy<WH2254> the humble<WH6041> with lying<WH8267> words,<WH561> even when the needy<WH34> speaks<WH1696> right.<WH4941>
But the noble<WH5081> devises<WH3289> noble<WH5081> things;<WH5081> and he will continue in noble things.<WH5081>
Rise up,<WH6965> you women<WH802> who are at ease!<WH7600> Hear<WH8085> my voice!<WH6963> You careless<WH982> daughters,<WH1323> give ear<WH238> to my speech!<WH565>
For days<WH3117> beyond a year<WH8141> you will be troubled,<WH7264> you careless women;<WH982> for the vintage<WH1210> shall fail.<WH3615> The harvest<WH625> won't<WH935> come.

Tremble,<WH2729> you women who are at ease!<WH7600> Be troubled,<WH7264> you careless ones!<WH982> Strip<WH6584> yourselves,<WH6209> make yourselves naked, and put<WH2290> sackcloth on your waist.<WH2504>
Beat<WH5594> your breasts<WH7699> for the pleasant<WH2531> fields,<WH7704> for the fruitful<WH6509> vine.<WH1612>
Thorns<WH6975> and briars<WH8068> will come up<WH5927> on my people<WH5971>'s land;<WH127> yes,<WH1004> on all the houses of joy<WH4885> in the joyous<WH5947> city.<WH7151>

For the palace<WH759> will be forsaken.<WH5203> The populous<WH1995> city<WH5892> will be deserted.<WH5800> The hill<WH6076> and the watchtower<WH975> will be for dens<WH4631> forever,<WH5704> <WH5769> a delight<WH4885> for wild donkeys,<WH6501> a pasture<WH4829> of flocks;<WH5739>

Until the Spirit<WH7307> is poured<WH6168> on us from on high,<WH4791> and the wilderness<WH4057> becomes a fruitful field,<WH3759> and the fruitful field<WH3759> is considered<WH2803> a forest.<WH3293>
Then justice<WH4941> will dwell<WH7931> in the wilderness;<WH4057> and righteousness<WH6666> will remain<WH3427> in the fruitful field.<WH3759>
The work<WH4639> of righteousness<WH6666> will be peace;<WH7965> and the effect<WH5656> of righteousness,<WH6666> quietness<WH8252> and confidence<WH983><WH99999> forever.<WH5769>
My people<WH5971> will live<WH3427> in a peaceful<WH7965> habitation,<WH5116> in safe<WH4009> dwellings,<WH4908> and in quiet<WH7600> resting places.<WH4496>
Though hail<WH1258> flattens<WH3381> the forest,<WH3293> and the city<WH5892> is leveled<WH8213> completely.<WH8218>
Blessed<WH835> are you who sow<WH2232> beside all waters,<WH4325> who send out<WH7971> the feet<WH7272> of the ox<WH7794> and the donkey.<WH2543>
